captions.text:
If youâ€™re planning on parking your
car here in Korea, you can park it on one

of these ferris wheels, and as soon as your
car getâ€™s on, hereâ€™s what happens

to it. It gets spun around and around. See
the cars constantly changing. And this is

a huge building, so you can imagine how far
up these cars go. Ohhh mother! This is the

first time Iâ€™ve ever seen anything
like this. How cool is that, I feel like such
a tourist again. God bless you Korea!
Ohh...Okay....

Simon is trying, sang nockjee (live small
octopus)
oh my gosh....thatâ€™s it! I did it!

There are all types of advertising in korea,
this is currently the most unique kind weâ€™ve

ever seen before. We think itâ€™s for
an army-type video game.

Okay, so this is what essential happens to
the streets on the weekend or any busy night,

in Bucheon or in any busy city in Korea. They
get littered with flyers, a lot of them with

highly inappropriate pictures that Iâ€™m
not going to show because we might get banned

from youtube.....okay I lied...thatâ€™s
it. But essentially it gets covered in flyers.

How does it get covered in flyers? Thatâ€™s
what the next video is for. Check it out.

So here is another fine example as to why
the street food in Korea is a thousand times

better than the street food in Canada. You
can see this is a delicious stick of chicken.

If you look over here behind you, you can
see the guy making the chicken in giant stacks,

and how much did this chicken stick cost you
Simon?
1,000 won which is roughly a Canadian dollar.

Ok, this is going to be a really short video
but this is really cool and you need to see

how awesome ice cream is in Korea. We went
to Baskin Robbins we got ourselves a pint

of ice cream, weâ€™re not going to eat
it of course, because weâ€™re very healthy.

Anyhow, underneath the ice cream we have a
small bag and this bag, if you can see it

smoking, is dry ice. They have given us dry
ice to keep our Baskin Robbins ice cream cold.

Look at it smoking. How much care and attention
to the fine quality of details does Korea

give to itâ€™s ice cream. God bless you
Korea! We love you!

comments.text:
Are you trying to say that if you have dissolved CO2 in water, completely 
dispersed, that no Carbonic acid will form at all, not even a small amount? 
That is highly unlikely because, water is constantly splitting and 
reforming H2O ~ H(+) + OH(-), it would definitely produce H2CO3 under the 
pressure used. If you stop breathing(no exhaling to lower the amounts of 
CO2 in the blood) Your cells will continue to produce more and more CO2 
until there is absolutely no O2 remaining. forming the acid.
comments.author: Chemeleon15

comments.text: You gotta love the flyer spreading guy!
comments.author: m91se

comments.text:
No, soda water is just CO2 gas dissolved in water. Carbonated water forms 
not because of less oxygen, but because of more CO2 build up. The 
equilibrium of the above reaction forces less Effervescence to occur, so 
more carbonic acid is formed in the blood, which decreases arterial and 
venular pH.
comments.author: cereaxx

comments.text:
Soda/seltzer water, it forms in your veins and arteries if you stop 
breathing O2
